item.title: [Delta]Recoloring Help
item.dc:creator: @dun_dun_dun dun dun dun
item.description:
@dun_dun_dun wrote:

Im not 100% sure on this but, where it says

class8.aStringArray189[1] = "null";

Why not just delete null out of it so that it looks like this?

Im not the best with custom items and stuff but thats just a guess

EDIT: I know this is in renamed but this is the int for a raw rocktail, it could be the same as another object you couldnt eat/wield/wear or anything like that, so if you got this in delta format maybe you could use it.

case 15271: itemDef.actions = new String[5]; itemDef.modelID = 48722; itemDef.modelZoom = 1460; itemDef.modelRotation1 = 499; itemDef.modelRotation2 = 1926; itemDef.modelOffset1 = 3; itemDef.modelOffset2 = 0; itemDef.name = "Raw rocktail"; itemDef.description = "I should try cooking this.".getBytes(); break;

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta]Recoloring Help
item.dc:creator: @CreatorAlex CreatorAlex
item.description:
@CreatorAlex wrote:

If you wanted to remove it, why does it say null? “Yu o @ dwarf remains” is what appears in old servers as a null.

(Whatever the hell a null is)

Have you tried (assuming you’re using 317) checking if 9999 is in item.java? It shouldn’t be.

Sorry if I got part of your question wrong there.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta]Recoloring Help
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

I’ve been messing around with recoloring items, and i have a question.
How do i remove the option to equip it?
I tried to remove where it said “Equip” but it came up as “Yu o @ dwarf remains”

This is my code

if(i == 9999) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "null"; class8.anIntArray156 = new int[1]; class8.anIntArray160 = new int[1]; class8.anIntArray156[0] = 7062; class8.anIntArray160[0] = 6073; class8.anInt174 = 2408; class8.anInt181 = 820; class8.anInt190 = 196; class8.anInt198 = 1180; class8.anInt204 = 0; class8.anInt169 = 1; class8.anInt194 = -8; class8.anInt165 = -1; class8.anInt200 = -1; class8.anInt188 = -1; class8.anInt164 = -1; class8.anInt175 = -1; class8.anInt197 = -1; class8.aString170 = "Dragonite Bar"; class8.aByteArray178 = "A bar of Dragonite.".getBytes(); }

Read full topic
